column1: Greek letter A: {{c1::capital ALPHA (AL-fuh)::capitalized? name?}} First letter of the Greek alphabet.
Greek letter α: {{c1::lowercase ALPHA (AL-fuh)::capitalized? name?}} First letter of the Greek alphabet.
Greek letter ϵ,ε: {{c1::lowercase EPSILON (EP-sil-on)::capitalized? name?}} A stylized form, ∈, is used as the “set membership” symbol.
Greek letter Π: {{c1::capital PI (PIE)::capitalized? name?}} The "product" symbol.
Greek letter π: {{c1::lowercase PI (PIE)::capitalized? name?}} Used to represent the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter.
Greek letter Σ: {{c1::capital SIGMA (SIG-muh)::capitalized? name?}} The "summation" symbol.
Greek letter Ω: {{c1::capital OMEGA (oh-MAY-guh)::capitalized? name?}} Last letter of the Greek alphabet.

Greek letter ω: {{c1::lowercase OMEGA (oh-MAY-guh)::capitalized? name?}} Last letter of the Greek alphabet. Denotes the smallest infinite ordinal in set-theory, isomorphic to the set of natural numbers.
Greek Alphabet: {{c1::A B Γ}} {{c2::Δ E Z}} {{c3::H Θ I}} {{c4::K Λ M}} {{c1::N Ξ O}} {{c2::Π P Σ}} {{c3::T Υ Φ}} {{c4::X Ψ Ω}}
Greek Alphabet: {{c1::α β γ}} {{c2::δ ε ζ}} {{c3::η θ ι}} {{c4::κ λ μ}} {{c1::ν ξ ο}} {{c2::π ρ σ/ς}} {{c3::τ υ φ/ϕ}} {{c4::χ ψ ω}}
